oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Joe Suglia - 1974 - WBUK
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Cal Smith (performer), Conway Twitty (performer), and Mickey Gilley (performer), conducted by Joe Suglia in 1974 on radio station WBUK.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Joe Suglia introduces Cal Smith -- Cal Smith talks about feeling great having got a number one record for the year -- Smith talks about some other of his big songs -- Smith talks about some upcoming records -- Smith talks about his idol being Ernest Tubb and also liking Conway Twitty and Don Williams -- Smith talks about working for Tubb -- Smith talks about how good a person Tubb is -- Smith talks about liking Loretta Lynn -- Smith talks about the other artists on his label -- Smith talks about not planning to do a duet -- Smith talks about all the other issues that come with recording a duet -- Smith talks about loving to tour and travel -- Smith talks about future plans -- Smith thanks Suglia and all of WBUK -- Cal Smith introduction for Joe Suglia and WBUK -- Joe Suglia introduces Mickey Gilley -- Gilley talks about how long he has been in the music industry -- Gilley talks about his strategy to success -- Gilley talks about preferring country ove rock and roll -- Gilley talks about the Country Music Awards and how he did not win anything -- Gilley talks about his touring schedule -- Gilley talks about dueting with Barbie Benton -- Gilley talks about liking Merle Haggard -- Gilley talks about being compared to his cousin, Jerry Lee Lewis -- Joe Suglia concludes the interview -- Mickey Gilley introduction for Joe Suglia and WBUK -- Joe Suglia introduces Conway Twitty -- Twitty talks about there being no formula for writing a hit record -- Twitty talks about knowing when a song is a hit -- Twitty talks about the state of the country music genre -- Twitty talks about artists not being happy with the Country Music Awards that year (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Smith, Cal; Twitty, Conway; Gilley, Mickey;
